tire_psi_lf.name: Left Front Tire Pressure
tire_psi_lf.effect: Higher pressure reduces heat buildup but reduces grip at lower loads. Lower pressure increases grip at lower speeds/loads.

tire_psi_rf.name: Right Front Tire Pressure
tire_psi_rf.effect: Most heavily loaded tire on left-turn ovals. Critical for turn entry stability.

handling_impact.decrease: Increases front mechanical grip, improves turn-in

tire_psi_lr.name: Left Rear Tire Pressure
tire_psi_lr.effect: Lower pressures increase contact patch for better drive-off.

handling_impact.increase: Reduces rear grip, increases oversteer on exit

tire_psi_rr.name: Right Rear Tire Pressure
tire_psi_rr.effect: Heavily loaded on ovals. Key for corner exit traction and mid-corner stability.

cross_weight.name: Cross Weight
cross_weight.effect: Weight on LR and RF tires as percentage of total. Major factor in mechanical balance.

handling_impact.increase: Stabilizes entry, helps drive-off, can increase understeer through center
handling_impact.decrease: Frees up rotation, can cause instability on exit

cross_weight.important_note: One of the most influential settings. Adjust via spring perch offsets while ARB disconnected.

track_bar_height_left.name: Track Bar Height (Left Side)
track_bar_height_left.effect: Controls rear roll center height. Higher = more rear roll stiffness = oversteer. Lower = more traction = understeer.

handling_impact.increase: Increases rear roll stiffness, increases oversteer
handling_impact.decrease: Reduces roll stiffness, increases rear traction, increases understeer

track_bar_height_left.rake_effect: Positive rake (right higher) increases oversteer on exit and adds skew.

spring_lf.name: Left Front Spring Rate
spring_lf.effect: Pigtail coil-bind spring. Very soft initial rate (~200 lb/in) transitions to selected rate when bound.

handling_impact.increase: Maintains splitter height better, can reduce mechanical grip
handling_impact.decrease: Increases mechanical grip, can allow excessive ride height change

spring_rf.name: Right Front Spring Rate
spring_rf.effect: Most heavily loaded corner. Pigtail spring for platform control. Typically stiffer than LF.

handling_impact.increase: Better aerodynamic control, less mechanical compliance
handling_impact.decrease: More mechanical grip, less aero stability

spring_lr.name: Left Rear Spring Rate
spring_lr.effect: Softer LR spring allows chassis roll, frees up car. Stiffer raises left side, tightens car.

handling_impact.increase: Raises left side, tightens car through corner, increases understeer
handling_impact.decrease: Allows more roll, frees car, reduces understeer

spring_rr.name: Right Rear Spring Rate
spring_rr.effect: Very stiff to maintain rear height under high loads. Use stiffest you can handle.

handling_impact.increase: Better rear height control, maintains aero platform
handling_impact.decrease: More rear compliance, can allow excessive squat

oversteer.description: Car is loose, rear end wants to come around. Loss of rear grip.

tire_psi_rr.rationale: Increases contact patch and mechanical grip at loaded RR tire

tire_psi_lr.rationale: Increases rear grip for better drive-off stability

track_bar_height_left.rationale: Lowers roll center, reduces rear roll stiffness, increases traction

cross_weight.rationale: Shifts weight to LR, stabilizes corner exit

spring_lr.rationale: Allows more roll, increases rear compliance

understeer.description: Car is tight, won't turn. Loss of front grip.

tire_psi_lf.rationale: Increases front contact patch for better turn-in

tire_psi_rf.rationale: Critical for turn entry. Increases mechanical grip.

cross_weight.rationale: Shifts weight forward, increases front grip

spring_lr.rationale: Reduces rear roll, tightens rear, balances front/rear grip

bottoming.description: Chassis hitting track surface. Excessive suspension compression.

splitter_height.warning: Below 0.25" causes aerodynamic stall and massive downforce loss
tuning_process: 1. Select spring rates based on track characteristics
2. Adjust Spring Angle to get splitter height close to target

rear_height.effect: Maximum downforce in this range. Higher adds drag without downforce gain.
rear_height.tuning: Set RR spring for target height, adjust LR spring for balance

process: 2. Disconnect ARB and increase Link Slack
3. Adjust all four spring perch offsets together
4. To increase cross: RR/LF right-click, LR/RF left-click
5. To decrease cross: RR/LF left-click, LR/RF right-click
crossweight_adjustment.diagnosis: If understeer through center OR rear spins on exit → likely need to REDUCE cross weight (counter-intuitive!)

weather_adjustment.hot_track: Increase cross weight 0.5-1.0% (more oversteer from less grip)
weather_adjustment.cool_track: Decrease cross weight 0.5-1.0% (more understeer from more grip)
weather_adjustment.primary_adjustment: Cross weight is ONLY adjustment needed for temperature changes

bristol_specific.characteristics: Loads right-side tires heavily, requires strong turn-in
setup_focus: Lower RR tire pressure for exit traction
Watch tire temps - high banking creates high loads

tire_pressure_all.note: Never run below 25 or above 35 PSI

bristol.name: Bristol Motor Speedway
characteristics: High banking loads right-side tires heavily
Tire management critical for longer runs
Lower rear pressures help exit traction
